name: J. Vernon McGee
description:
J. Vernon McGee (1904 - 1988)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. In 1967 he started the now famous "Through The Bible" radio program that airs on thousands of stations world-wide.

His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. In 1967 he started the now famous "Through The Bible" radio program that airs on thousands of stations world-wide.

His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. In 1967 he started the now famous "Through The Bible" radio program that airs on thousands of stations world-wide.

His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. In 1967 he started the now famous "Through The Bible" radio program that airs on thousands of stations world-wide.

His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. In 1967 he started the now famous "Through The Bible" radio program that airs on thousands of stations world-wide.

His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Illumination I
audio_sermons.description: McGee delights in how limitless the voice of the Spirit in the Bible is. Not even great Bible scholars can discover these treasures in a whole lifetime.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
J. Vernon McGee (1904 - 1988)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. In 1967 he started the now famous "Through The Bible" radio program that airs on thousands of stations world-wide.

His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Illumination II
audio_sermons.description: Reminding how the Spirit of God wrote through men, without error, yet without destroying their personality. The Bible is the “hidden” mysteries of God written down through men.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
J. Vernon McGee (1904 - 1988)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. In 1967 he started the now famous "Through The Bible" radio program that airs on thousands of stations world-wide.

His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) In What Way Is the Bible Unique
audio_sermons.description: McGee points out the paradox that the Bible has “dual” authorship.  While the ultimate author is God, many different men were used to write the Bible. He draws comparisons to the God/Man authorship of the Bible to the Word becoming flesh in Jesus Christ. He affirms both the divinity and humanity of the Bible as important to reach mankind.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
J. Vernon McGee (1904 - 1988)

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Inspiration I
audio_sermons.description: The importance of understanding that all scripture is “God-Breathed”.   He makes sure to note that it’s not the mere thoughts that are inspired…but the very WORDS. (For it is WRITTEN…)

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Inspiration II
audio_sermons.description: This sermon continues to point out that it is the very words of Scripture that are inspired, and not just the thoughts behind them.

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Interpretation I
audio_sermons.description: A look at correct interpretation of scripture. He notes, in the Bible publishing market, that there is a difference between translations and paraphrases.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
J. Vernon McGee (1904 - 1988)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Interpretation II
audio_sermons.description: A look at what makes a good intepretation of the Bible. He warns that he can not recommend modern versions of the Bible, because of the presence of doctrinal or cultural biases from the translators. Still he values them as “interpretations” useful for occasional cross reference. In the end he has the highest confidence in the Authroized Version, and the Scofield Study Bible.

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Introduction
audio_sermons.description: This is not a Bible message, but a very brief introduction to J Veron McGee’s radio ministry.

J. Vernon McGee (1904 - 1988)

His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Is the Bible Important
audio_sermons.description: Beginning with an affirmation that ALL of the Bible is the Word of God, McGee recalls how he had to mature from reading it piece meal to reading it through. He exhorts us to read the Bible through all 66 books. In fact, this was the mission for His radio ministry, “Through the Bible” in which he took listeners through every chapter and almost every verse of the Bible over the course of 5 years.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
J. Vernon McGee (1904 - 1988)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Meditate on the Bible
audio_sermons.description: The Word of God is to be before His children continually. We should write the word on our doorposts, and the gates of our homes, and everywhere we live. McGee recalls a conversation he had with an advertising executive from Coca Cola about how serious the world is in reinforcing its message everywhere. In practical ways he suggests using car travel time, or bedtime for additional Bible time.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
J. Vernon McGee (1904 - 1988)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Obey the Bible
audio_sermons.description: One of the most obvious guidelines to the Bible…obey it! Obedience is essential to an understanding of the Bible. Examples from scripture, to show us how we have no right to expect God to talk to us if we do not have ‘obedience that comes from faith.’ Either the Bible will keep us from sin, or sin will keep us from the Bible.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
J. Vernon McGee (1904 - 1988)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Pass It On To Others
audio_sermons.description: After we read, study, meditate, obey, we should pass it on to others. He notes that we will reach a ‘saturation point’ in studying the Bible without sharing what we have learned. We must exhort others with what we have learned in the scriptures. Sharing the Word of God is a powerful way to learn it ourselves.

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Pratical Ways To Learn The Bible
audio_sermons.description: 7 Guidelines, taken from the Psalms, to follow in learning the Word of God. He likens following these guidelines to following the directions on a bottle of medicine, in order to get the most benefit.

audio_sermons.title: (Guidelines) Revelation
audio_sermons.description: A look at the phenomena of Revelation from God to man.  He used Helen Keller’s autobiographical comments of how understanding came to her all at once, to explain how spiritually blind and deaf mankind is being communicated to by God. He goes on to explain that God can use creation, experiences, our hearts, and above all, the Bible to speak to us. He ends this sermon with a strong affirmation of the reliability of the Bible. He quotes B. B. Warfield. “The Bible is the Word of God in such a sense, that whatever it says, God says.”

audio_sermons.description: McGee recalls that early in his ministry he was an ‘apologetics preacher’ but in later years he moved away from this emphasis. He explains this by observing that apologetics are helpful to helping a person believe the Bible is the Word of God, but only the Spirit can allow a person to know this. He reemphasizes this point by saying that we can’t rely on biblical archaeology or science to confirm the Word of God…the Holy Spirit must become real to us.

audio_sermons.title: Gifts of the Holy Spirit - Part 1
audio_sermons.description: Regarding the distribution of gifts, McGee says, “This is not a spiritual smorgasbord where you come to the counter and you take what you want.”    If this were so, most would take the more exciting gifts such as tongues, while those gifts such as giving or helping would be less popular. audio_sermons.title: God’s War on Poverty and Riches
audio_sermons.description: Calling attention to the unequal distribution of wealth in this fallen world, McGee observes that both poverty and riches are a curse to men. He exhorts the poor to avoid the pitfalls of sloth and laziness and to value hard work. He exhorts the wealthy to avoid the pitfalls of forming snobbish cliques in church, prideful attitudes, and indifference to the poor. He ends with reminding us from the book of Job, that God is thinking of the poor “in their affliction” and therefore so must we.

audio_sermons.title: Jeremiah The Man of Sorrows
audio_sermons.description: McGee makes comparison of Jesus’ ministry coward’s Jerusalem with the tragic calling of Jeremiah. He examines three aspects of the sorrow of Jeremiah. First he looks at the prophet’s “sincerity” as characterized by bitter loneliness and unpopularity. Second there is the “significance” of Jeremiah’s sorrow, namely that God would judge Israel’s sin. Thirdly, McGee looks at the solution to Jeremiah’s sorrow; the promise of the coming “Righteous Branch…the Lord our Righteousness.”

audio_sermons.title: Justification By Works
audio_sermons.description: A look at Justification by works in the book of James as compared to Paul’s doctrine of “Justification by Faith.” McGee observed that Paul and James were not standing “face to face” contradicting each other, but rather standing “back to back” defending true biblical faith against two different foes. While Paul was affirming the power of real saving faith, James was criticizing the impotency of empty professing faith.  The sermon ends with Pauls’ exhortation. “Examine yourselves whether ye be in the faith.”  (Interesting side note: McGee claimed as inaccurate the familiar story that Martin Luther called James an “Epistle of straw”.)

audio_sermons.title: The Potter and the Clay
audio_sermons.description: McGee examines the picture of the “potter” and “clay” to look at the truthful relationship between God and mankind. He notes that God created man from the dust of the Earth while saying “Let us make man in our own image.” Even though man is merely a created being, man no longer recognizes God’s right and authority to form and shape his creation according to the “pleasure of his own will.” Yet, rather then a call to become passive and fatalistic, this sermon is a call for faithful obedience and trust just as God is faithful to never remove us from his potters wheel.

audio_sermons.title: What and Where Is Heaven
audio_sermons.description: McGee begins his message   by reminding us that the Bible says little about   heaven.  However, he does not leave us disappointed!He extracts teachings from John 14 and Revelation 21 in such a way that a longing for heaven is stirred within us. He begins by describing characteristics of heaven that are of lesser  interest and progresses towards the most  exciting aspect of our hope: “Behold, I make all things new.”

audio_sermons.title: What is Worldliness?
audio_sermons.description: McGee asks the question “What is Worldliness?” He begins his answer by first dismissing some of the more popular answers such as carnal amusement, running with wrong people, inappropriate dress, preoccupation with money, and neglecting the church. Instead, true worldliness is the jealousy, the pride, the rivalries, and the selfish ambitions we invite into our churches. The sermon ends with a call for renewed consecration to God and humble communion with one another.

audio_sermons.title: What is your Life?
audio_sermons.description: A scriptural reminder that this life is brief and uncertain. Yet in a world of uncertainty McGee reminds believers they can be sure of their salvation!  Paul’s words are used to sum up this certainty in Jesus Christ: “I know whom I have believed, and I am pursuaded that he able to keep that which I have committed unto him against that day.” The sermon ends with the simple profound invitation. “Come now.”
